abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed loan would make available
            US$48.7 million equivalent for general balance of payments
            and budgetary support for the Government's economic
            recovery program, as outlined in a letter on Development
            Policies from the Government to the Bank. Foreign exchange
            would be used for essential imports of raw materials,
            intermediate goods, spare parts and capital goods.
            Counterpart funds would be used to finance projects in the
            approved public investment program. About US$1.3 million
            equivalent would be made available to finance technical
            studies in the areas of mineral tax reform, agricultural
            export promotion and prefeasibility studies in mining and
            agriculture sectors.
